metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5696 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
inc/central.class.php in GLPI before 0.84.2 does not attempt to makeinstall/install.php unavailable after an installation is completed, whichallows remote attackers to conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF)attacks, and (1) perform a SQL injection via an Etape_4 action or (2)execute arbitrary PHP code via an update_1 action.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glpi - 0.84.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glpi package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.84.2-1').
